instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.USBC_XA_CC2: What is USBC_XA_CC2? USBC_XA_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one of the 4 usb not working
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> not giving any power i test the traces from j3300 on line
 <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> good 
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL> good
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC2</SIGNAL> has a short to ground i think it <CAPACITOR>C3114</CAPACITOR> or dz3301 i removed both and still have short does that mean <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is bad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one of the 4 usb not working
threads.message: If nothing else is connected there...
